criteria: Accurately describing the increasing or decreasing intervals of a function from a graph.
Identifying linear or non-linear sections of a function from a graph.
Sketching a graph from a verbal description of a function's qualitative features.
descriptions: The student cannot identify or describe any increasing or decreasing intervals.
The student attempts to identify increasing or decreasing intervals but struggles with accuracy.
The student can identify either increasing or decreasing intervals with some accuracy, but not both.
The student accurately identifies either increasing or decreasing intervals but struggles with detailed explanations.
The student accurately describes both increasing and decreasing intervals with clear explanations.
The student provides a comprehensive and nuanced description of increasing and decreasing intervals, including rates of change and contextual interpretations.
The student cannot identify any linear or non-linear sections.
The student attempts to identify linear or non-linear sections but shows significant misunderstanding.
The student can identify either linear or non-linear sections with some accuracy.
The student identifies linear and non-linear sections but struggles to explain why.
The student accurately identifies and explains linear and non-linear sections with supporting reasoning.
The student offers a sophisticated analysis of linear and non-linear sections, including discussions of constant vs. changing rates and real-world implications.
The student does not attempt to sketch a graph or the sketch is completely unrelated to the description.
The student attempts a sketch, but it bears little resemblance to the described features.
The student captures one or two basic features of the function in their sketch.
The student includes most of the key qualitative features in their sketch, but with some inaccuracies or omissions.
The student accurately sketches a graph that includes all the key qualitative features described.

The student produces a highly accurate and detailed sketch, demonstrating a deep understanding of the relationship between verbal descriptions and graphical representations, and anticipates subtle functional behaviors.
